item.title: 通胀终于失去了控制市场的力量
item.description:
服务业的顽固性仍需磨灭，但美联储已经赢得了这场消耗战。【原文：

The stubbornness of services still needs grinding down, but the Fed has won this war of attrition.

】

item.title: 股市下滑，中国投资者再次抢购企业债券
item.description: 随着股市连续两周大涨的势头开始减弱，投资者再次回到中国企业债券市场。【原文：Investors are returning to China’s corporate bond market again as a two-week stock market surge starts to lose steam.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事欧洲
item.description:
及时了解市场监测情况

Get up to speed with what the markets are monitoring

】

item.title: 日本最大的商业游说团体呼吁扩建核电站
item.description: 日本最大的商业游说团体日本经济团体联合会（Keidanren）呼吁政府将核能扩张纳入正在修订的国家能源战略。【原文：Japan’s biggest business lobby Keidanren called on the government to include nuclear power expansion in the national energy strategy currently under revision.】

item.title: 氧化铝因供应中断和中国需求而飙升至创纪录水平
item.description: 由于全球供应中断和中国需求的恢复继续收紧铝冶炼厂的主要原料市场，上海氧化铝期货飙升至创纪录水平。【原文：Alumina futures in Shanghai spiked to a record as global supply disruptions and resilient Chinese demand continue to tighten the market of the main feedstock for aluminum smelters.】

item.title: 野村称中国对亚洲的经济溢出效应取决于房地产
item.description: 野村控股公司（Nomura Holdings Inc.）的分析显示，中国对亚洲国家的外溢效应在过去几年中有所减弱，中国政府如何部署预期中的财政刺激措施，将对亚洲国家对世界第二大经济体的出口能否恢复至关重要。【原文：China’s spillovers to Asian nations have weakened over the past few years and how Beijing deploys an expected fiscal boost will be critical to whether their exports to the world’s No. 2 economy revive, analysis by Nomura Holdings Inc. shows.】

item.title: 设定体育博彩赔率的公司内幕
item.description:
大额数据交易和先进的统计模型有助于预测比赛结果，让人们继续投注。【原文：

Big-money data deals and advanced statistical models are helping to predict match outcomes and keep people betting.

】

item.title: 伦敦老板们仍在等待基尔-斯塔默的宏伟发展计划
item.description:
英国新一届工党政府成立一百天之际，政府高层表示 "我们不能无限期地脱离细节"

。【原文：

One hundred days into Britain’s new Labour government, executives say ‘we can’t live without the details indefinitely.’

】

item.title: 英国与瑞士重启贸易谈判，推动 "全球英国 "建设
item.description: 英国和瑞士的贸易谈判代表将于周一重启贸易谈判，他们将寻求更深入地进入对方的金融服务市场，并就数据共享和工人签证达成协议。【原文：British and Swiss trade negotiators will resume trade talks on Monday as they seek to broker deeper access to each other’s financial services markets as well as agreements on data sharing and worker visas.】

item.title: 欧洲央行明年将加快减息步伐以解除经济桎梏
item.description: 彭博社的一项调查显示，欧洲央行将在未来数月加快降息步伐，以促进经济发展；到2025年底，借贷成本将降至不再限制需求的水平。【原文：The European Central Bank will speed up interest-rate cuts over the months ahead to bolster the economy — taking borrowing costs to levels that no longer restrict demand by the end of 2025, according to a Bloomberg survey.】

item.title: 日本财务省将暂停野村的债务拍卖活动
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，在野村控股公司承认操纵债券期货市场后，日本财务省计划暂时禁止该公司参与国债拍卖。【原文：Japan’s Ministry of Finance plans to temporarily exclude Nomura Holdings Inc. from taking part in government debt auctions after the firm admitted to manipulating the bond futures market, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 对冲基金七年涨幅达 800% 买空中国科技股
item.description: 一家绩优中国对冲基金正在买入在香港上市的中国科技股，称即使在今年强劲反弹之后，这些股票的估值仍然便宜。【原文：A top-performing Chinese hedge fund is buying the dip in Hong Kong-listed China technology stocks, saying valuations remain cheap even after their strong rally this year.】

item.title: 马斯克展示特斯拉网约车，预计成本低于 3 万美元，2026 年亮相
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）公布了人们期待已久的特斯拉公司（Tesla Inc.【原文：Elon Musk unveiled long-awaited prototypes of a Tesla Inc. robotaxi called the Cybercab, saying that production may start in 2026 and that the vehicle could cost less than $30,000.】

item.title: 印度银行股上涨 1%，成为表现最好的板块
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 韩康获得诺贝尔奖引发韩国出版商股票大涨
item.description: 韩国作家韩江获得诺贝尔奖引发了韩国图书和出版业的兴奋，这种反应甚至波及到股票市场。【原文：South Korean author Han Kang’s Nobel Prize win sparked excitement in the country’s books and publishing industry, with the reaction even spreading to the stock market.】

item.title: 尽管三星股价相对于同行的折价率创下新高，但 "逢低买入 "者仍对其避而远之
item.description: 三星电子公司已今非昔比。【原文：Samsung Electronics Co. is not what it used to be.】

item.title: 中国股市在重要简报发布前扩大本周跌幅
item.description: 周五早盘，中国股市下跌，投资者在等待财政部在定于明天举行的政策吹风会上宣布多少新的刺激措施。【原文：Chinese stocks fell early on Friday as investors waited to see how much new stimulus the Ministry of Finance will announce at a policy briefing scheduled for tomorrow.】

item.title: 印度经济衰退，Infosys 和 Wipro 面临更大压力，难以达到预期目标
item.description: Infosys Ltd.、Wipro Ltd.和 HCL Technologies Ltd.被寄予厚望，因为投资者越来越担心潜在的市场调整。【原文：Infosys Ltd., Wipro Ltd. and HCL Technologies Ltd. are up against high expectations as investors increasingly fret over a potential market correction.】

item.title: 以色列计划应对伊朗袭击，石油将实现周线上涨
item.description: 由于以色列准备对伊朗实施报复，中东地区的原油供应有可能中断，石油价格走低，但仍有望实现第二周上涨。【原文：Oil edged lower — while remaining on course for a second weekly gain — as Israel readied plans to retaliate against Iran, raising the specter of disruptions to crude supplies from the Middle East.】

item.title: 财政部长称墨西哥城计划发行可持续债务
item.description: 墨西哥城新任财政部长胡安-巴勃罗-德波顿（Juan Pablo de Botton）表示，墨西哥城打算利用当地可持续债务市场为电动汽车、水和社会包容项目提供资金。【原文：Mexico City intends to tap the local sustainable debt market to fund projects in electromobility, water and social inclusion, according to its new finance chief Juan Pablo de Botton.】

item.title: ESPN 的斯蒂芬-A-史密斯像选股票一样选体育，做空高尔夫球
item.description: 当被要求像股票一样对体育项目进行排名时，ESPN 主播斯蒂芬-A-史密斯（Stephen A. Smith）说，他会买入棒球和女子篮球，但会卖出高尔夫和拳击。【原文：Asked to rank sports like stocks, ESPN anchor Stephen A. Smith said he’d buy baseball and women’s basketball, but sell golf and boxing.】

item.title: 美国数据好坏参半，美联储加息路径不明，黄金周线将收跌
item.description: 在通胀率高于预期和劳动力市场放缓加剧了对美联储下月降息预期规模的争论之后，黄金走势趋稳，继续保持周线跌势。【原文：Gold steadied to remain on track for a weekly loss, after hotter-than-expected inflation and a slowdown in the labor market amplified debate over the size of the Federal Reserve’s expected rate cut next month.】

item.title: 上游生物扩大上市规模，领跑三家生命科学公司 IPO
item.description: 本周四，在三家美国生命科学公司中，有两家迄今已超过或达到首次公开募股的目标，显示出投资者对这些资本密集型企业的青睐。【原文：Two of three US life-sciences companies have so far exceeded or met their goals in initial public offerings Thursday, showing investor appetite for their capital-intensive businesses after a busy stretch of fundraising by peers.】

item.title: 韩国锌业董事长在收购战中提高对关键部门的报价
item.description: 韩国锌业公司（Korea Zinc Co.）将其对 Young Poong Precision Corp. 的收购要约提高了 17%，使争夺全球最大锌冶炼厂控制权的战斗升级。【原文：Korea Zinc Co. has raised its offer for Young Poong Precision Corp. by 17%, escalating the battle for control of the world’s biggest zinc smelter.】

item.title: 宜家业主为推动绿色发展增持澳大利亚风电场股份
item.description: 拥有全球大部分宜家商店的英卡集团的投资部门收购了澳大利亚维多利亚州一个大型风力发电厂的新股份。【原文：The investment arm of Ingka Group, which owns most of the world’s Ikea stores, has acquired new stakes in a large Australian wind farm in Victoria state.】

item.title: 面对坚挺的物价 新加坡金管局将维持货币汇率不变
item.description: 新加坡将逆全球宽松趋势而动，继续保持其政策取向，因为官员们将利用货币的强势来应对仍然过高的生活成本。【原文：Singapore is set to buck the global easing trend and keep its policy bearings on hold as officials use the strength of the currency to tackle still-exorbitant living costs.】

item.title: 以色列计划应对伊朗袭击，石油将实现周线上涨
item.description: 继周四飙升逾 3% 之后，原油迎来第二周上涨，原因是以色列准备对伊朗实施报复，从而引发了中东原油供应中断的担忧。【原文：Oil headed for a second weekly gain — after surging by more than 3% on Thursday — as Israel readied plans to retaliate against Iran, raising the specter of disruptions to crude supplies from the Middle East.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 早上好。交易员在考虑美联储的下一步行动，美国股市下跌。沙丘 "工作室寻求收购万达股份。据说贝莱德将投资印度现代汽车的首次公开募股。市场动态如下。【原文：Good morning. US stocks fall as traders mull Fed’s next move. `Dune' studio looks to buy out Wanda's stake. BlackRock is said to invest in Hyundai India’s IPO. Here’s what’s moving markets. —Isabelle Lee】

item.title: 秘鲁出人意料地保持主要同行中的最低比率
item.description: 秘鲁周四出人意料地维持基准利率不变，因为该国经济增长超出预期，借贷成本在拉美主要经济体中已经是最低的。【原文：Peru surprisingly held its benchmark interest rate unchanged Thursday as the economy grows above expectations and borrowing costs already rank as the lowest among Latin America’s major economies.】

item.title: 亚洲股市将避开华尔街在 CPI 之后的跌势：市场综述
item.description: 在核心通胀率高于预期和劳动力市场放缓引发有关美联储下月可能降息的讨论之后，亚洲股市将无视美国股市的跌势。【原文：Asian equities were set to ignore losses in their US peers after hotter-than-expected core inflation and a slowdown in the labor market fueled debate about a potential Federal Reserve interest-rate cut next month.】
